Posts.Content: Fantastic news Celia and well done!  Do still pop in and see us xx
Posts.Title: ALL CLEAR

Posts.Content: Hi Lottie I haven't no - but then I am nearly 48 and I hadnt had one for ages prior to starting treatment?  The last one i had was after my bone scan in April 2010 - and I put that down to the effects of the scan rather than anything else.  I don't think it's unheard of to have periods whilst on tamoxifen - although probably best to check with your BCN? Hope this helps!
Posts.Title: Zoladex & Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy Cant help with the zoladex I'm afraid but I've been taking tamoxifen since end November 2010.  For me the immediate side effects were not pleasant - night sweats, hot flushes, aching legs - I used to have to hobble down the stairs one at a time and if I sat still too long I'd be hobbling too. I'd say its taken a good six months for me to get settled - the night sweats are few and far between, still get a couple of hot flushes each day (compared to 5 or 6) and although my legs not quite back to normal they are miles better.  I'm not sure if they have affected my moods because I always was a bit moody anyway :-) Have you spoken to your BCN about any possible alternatives?
Posts.Title: Zoladex & Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hello I didnt have herceptin or any scans at the end of treatment either.  I had chemo and then a lumpectomy followed by radiotherapy and now take tamoxifen.  I was told after the op and axillary clearance that there was a clear margin (no cancerous cells remained) and was given scans prior to treatment to ensure it hadn't spread (which it hadn't).  After my first post treatment mammogram I was told there was 'no evidence of disease'.  I think being told you are 'in remission' in very much dependent on the hospital - I phoned my key nurse to ask the same question and she said they dont really use the word remission for breast cancer but that technically I was 'cancer free'.  I also think that technically i dont get the 'all clear' until 5 years is up.  Do you have a key nurse you could phone to check?  If nothing else it would put your mind at rest. Good luck.
Posts.Title: scans after Herceptin?

Posts.Content: Hi Jules I managed to work through most of my chemotherapy - as my side effects were cumulative I found that for the 3rd and 4th cycle of each (EC and Taxol) I was unable to work as normal - I had chemo on the Friday and then had the Mon-Wed the following week off sick.  For the earlier ones I worked at home on the Mon and Tues and travelled to work as normal on the Wed.  I worked throughout radiotherapy and just had the time off for hospital appointments.  I had no real side effects in terms of tiredness - to be honest I didnt feel tired at all.  I did have some minor skin blistering though - but it was very minor and the hospital gave me dressings and gel which really helped. My one motto during treatment was 'if I can, I will, if I can't, I won't'. Dont push yourself too hard and rest when you need to - listen to what your body is telling you - especially during the chemo stage. You need to do what you feel you can, nothing more. Good luck and hope all goes well. xx
Posts.Title: feeling positive

Posts.Content: Hi Ostrich - I didnt get any more tired than normal but that differs for everyone.  I think you will just have to see how it affects you and adjust accordingly? Corrine
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hiya I got similar side effects - and they are still with me!  Sometimes it feels like my boob is swollen and stiff - its rather like getting cramp?  Sometimes I think my left boob has a life of its own - however I seem to remember reading that its all perfectly normal? You're lucky with the hotties - wish I could have said the same about mine lol!
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: hi Sue I apologise if I caused any offence - as Tess says no-one is aiming anything at you - more at the so called 'experts' spreading what I can only see is nonsense. Its a bit like being told I shouldn't have my legs waxed or my feet pedicured as I have diabetes - twaddle.  If it ever got to the point that I had neuropathy and couldn't feel my legs or feet then I may think again, but all the time I am feeling normal (well as normal as I can under the circumstances lol) then I dont even fess up to having it. I can understand the need to be sensible here in terms of massage - it's just a shame that there is so much nonsense to be found! Take care xx
Posts.Title: Is a massage dangerous?

Posts.Content: Lol - had to reply to this!  Is ironing bad for cancer too?  Or hoovering? :-) We have a masseuse at work one day a month who can do various forms of massage - I had one after my op while still having RT - I was originally going to have back and shoulder massage but she suggested lymph drainage as I had axillary clearance.  At no point did she say anything about massaging causing cancer to spread etc.  I'm also pretty sure that the Marsden in Sutton (where I am) have complementary massages that you can have - so they can't be that dangerous can they?!? Good luck with finding a massage person who knows what they are talking about ;-)
Posts.Title: Is a massage dangerous?

Posts.Content: Hi - I had taxol and it affected my fingernails - they didnt lift of but became all ridgy and they are still very weak - 11 months after last dose!  Not very encouraging but reckon it is down to the chemo.
Posts.Title: losing fingernails!

Posts.Content: Hi - I had taxol and it affected my fingernails - they didnt lift of but became all ridgy and they are still very weak - 11 months after last dose!  Not very encouraging but reckon it is down to the chemo.
Posts.Title: losing fingernails!

Posts.Content: My advice would be to shave it off - I did - when the fluffy bits started coming back I shaved it again - and after that it came back properly.  4-5 weeks after my last taxol it started to come back like proper hair!  As Theresa said - shave it - at least you are in control then. x
Posts.Title: hair growing back but also have bit of old hair....

Posts.Content: Hi Caryn I had taxol after 4 rounds of EC.  With the taxol I had joint and bone pain (I found co-codamol usually did the trick when it got too bad - and it certainly helped me sleep) as well as having no appetite and lilttle energy.  I think the joint and bone ache is fairly common, but as Kate said - speak to your nurse and she'll be able to advise you more fully. Corrine
Posts.Title: Taxol Chemo (Paclitaxel)

Posts.Content: Hey Norvan I'm in the same situation although a bit ahead.  I had my first mammo in April - I'm still numb/tender in places after the WLE and told them that - it was a bit painful, but not too much and they were sensitive to that.  I too have a dent, hot flushes, mood swings, aching legs, cramps...and am struggling to lose chemo weight. I still say its a small price to pay. I'd tell the mammo nurses how you feel - I did.  Good luck - let me know how it goes - mine came back NED which was a great relief!
Posts.Title: 1 Year On, Mammogram Due .. nervous
